definitions.title: What Are Communicative Styles?
definitions.definition: Communicative styles refer to the way we express ourselves when we talk to others. They depend on the situation, relationship, and purpose of the conversation.
definitions.example: Example: The way you talk to your best friend is different from how you talk to your teacher.
definitions.explanation: Each situation requires a different level of formality. Understanding these styles helps us communicate more effectively and respectfully.

definitions.title: Frozen Style
definitions.definition: The frozen style is the most formal and fixed type of communication. The words are unchanging and often memorized or recited.
definitions.example: Example: Prayers, national anthems, oaths, and the Preamble of the Constitution.
definitions.explanation: This style does not change. It is often used in ceremonies, rituals, or formal declarations.

definitions.title: Formal Style
definitions.definition: The formal style is used in structured situations where precise language and grammar are important.
definitions.example: Example: Delivering a speech, reporting in class, or writing an academic paper.
definitions.explanation: This style avoids slang and contractions. It‚Äôs used when the speaker does not expect feedback during the communication.

definitions.title: Consultative Style
definitions.definition: The consultative style is used in professional or semi-formal situations where feedback is expected.
definitions.example: Example: A student consulting a teacher or a patient talking to a doctor.
definitions.explanation: It involves respectful conversation with some exchange of information or clarification between participants.

definitions.title: Casual Style
definitions.definition: The casual style is used between friends or peers in informal situations. It often includes slang, jokes, and relaxed grammar.
definitions.example: Example: 'Hey dude, what‚Äôs up?' or 'Let‚Äôs hang out later!'
definitions.explanation: It‚Äôs spontaneous and natural, showing familiarity and comfort between speakers.

definitions.title: Intimate Style
definitions.definition: The intimate style is used between people who are very close, such as family members, lovers, or best friends.
definitions.example: Example: 'Good night, honey.' or 'I love you, Mom.'
definitions.explanation: It often includes pet names, private language, or shared emotional expressions that only close people understand.

definitions.title: Why Are Communicative Styles Important?
definitions.definition: Knowing when to use each style helps us communicate effectively and respectfully.
definitions.example: Example: Using formal style in interviews and casual style when chatting with friends.
definitions.explanation: Each context has its appropriate tone and language. Choosing the right one builds better relationships and avoids misunderstandings.
